Various apps: Support App 2 SD, and run on non-touch-screen devices. Only OI Countdown is not allowed to be moved to SD card, because alarms are suspended and are not automatically recreated when SD card is mounted. Tag 'supports-screens' is no longer required if 'targetSdkVersion' is set to 4 or higher. Permissions have been tested using: aapt dump badging xxx.apk Fixes issue 289.

git-svn-id: https://openintents.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@3184 72b678ce-9140-0410-bee8-679b907dd61a

OI Safe: Apply patch by Rachee Singh: Delete password from clipboard when logging out.

1. When the text (username/password) is copied to the clipboard, it is also copied to a static string variable in Safe.java.
2. When the safe is locked, the clipboard is compared to this static variable, and if it is the same as the last stored password, the clipboard is cleared.
Safe.java isn't terminated until the application terminates, so the static variable we need is retained.

Fixes issue 297.

Various OI apps: GCI task by Darriel: Update menu shortcuts to avoid conflict with Android 4.0 shortcuts. Fixes issue 436. http://www.google-melange.com/gci/task/view/google/gci2011/7184249 --------------- New shortcuts:

OI NotePad
CTRL + S - Save
CTRL + W - Save As
Delete shortcut removed
CTRL + P - Preferences/Settings

OI Countdown
Changed a CTRL+S to CTRL+P (everywhere one shortcut for settings)
Removed the Delete shortcuts too.

OI File Manager
Changed again S to P for Settings. Also noticed that there was a conflict with Include/Exclude Media Scan - they also use s  for shortcut. Now it should be OK.

OI Safe (CategoryList.java)

DEL_CATEGORY_INDEX - removed the CTRL-D shortcut, following the policy of 'no delete shortcuts'.

ADD_CATEGORY_INDEX - possible conflict with default Android shortcuts - CTRL+A. No changes made, though, as I'm not absolutely sure it will conflict (not sure if android's 'select all' is callable there, if there is nothing to select)

OI Shopping List

Removed a delete shortcut. The other shortcuts look OK.

Merge pull request #1 from chaideos/localBranch

fix issue #516 (from chaideos)
Added gitignore to skip standard Android files
Removed some overrides to better compile with JDK6 and an annotation to deal with lint.
Added wrapper for ClipboardManager to handle Honeycomb version of the API

Changed dialogs that use BUTTON1 and/or BUTTON2 to use the newer
BUTTON_POSITIVE and BUTTON_NEGATIVE.
Bumped sdkTarget to Jelly Bean.   Bumped version to 1.3.1-beta
Updated the progress dialog for Search to no longer use deprecated showDialog()
Migrated Search to use Fragments.  OI Safe now uses the Support Library v4.
Missed some of the rest of the changes for Search using fragments.

Bumped minSdkVersion to 4 to handle Support Library v4.
In order to make Lint happy, removed debuggable and changed sequence
of the permissions.

Since converting to fragments, 'results' was not maintained across
orientation changes.  Added onSaveInstanceState() and
onActivityCreated() to save results across the lifecycle.
correct value for nine
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:openintents/safe
Converted PassEdit to use Fragments
Since we bumped to API4, we don't need the custom Build to figure out SDK_INT.

Corrected a bug with Jelly Bean that ignored showNext() on ViewFlipper().
This fixes the initial view.   Unfortunately swiping or previous/next
still has issues on Jelly Bean.

Fixed flipper on PassView.   Jelly Bean didn't seem to handle showNext().
Changed to setDisplayedChild().
Also adjusted min/max swipe to be dynamically based on current view width
to better handle the larger pixel width.
Changed a debug flag to false and adjusted min pixel percentage for swipe on PassView.

Mimiced how ShoppingList launcher behaves and created a FrontDoor
class extending Safe and made it the main launcher.   This way
previous installations that refer to FrontDoor for the launcher icon
will still work.   And now in Eclipse Safe automatically launches
and debug works.

Added Search to the CategoryList ActionBar.showIfRoom.  I personally
never use the lock item.   For that I just lock the phone which causes
safe to lock.   But I do use search quite frequently.

Fixed a Jelly Bean bug with IME_ACTION_SEARCH on the SearchFragment.
It's talked about at
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11301061/null-keyevent-and-actionid-0-in-oneditoraction-jelly-bean-nexus-7
Renamed version to 1.4-rc for a proposed release candidate and updated the readme.txt to describe the Jelly Bean fixes
release 1.4
Updated backup and import progress dialogs.
To keep lint happy, switched to getExternalStorageDirectory() for legacy reference to original password safe .csv file.

Completely refactored the import and backup threads.  Lint was
complaining about the Handler class should be static or leaks
might occur.   Switched to using AsyncTask.

It's actually more resilent to the Activity lifecycle.   Before
the onPause() would try to cancel the background thread.  Now it
uses a static to keep track of the AsyncTask.  Perhaps that should
be in a bundle?

But now lint is perfectly happy with CategoryList.java
Fix journal security hole
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:openintents/safe
release 1.4.1
